intro: Thlaspi alpestre subsp. calaminare, commonly known as the alpine pennycress, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually alternate and pinnately divided, while its flowers are yellowish and arranged in clusters. It is known for its ability to tolerate harsh climatic conditions and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems.
